name: molly conger
tweet: tonight's charlottesville city council meeting should be underway shortly. the closed session is running a little long.  https://t.co/aVPE1UtOmy

name: molly conger
tweet: personally, i hope the closed session conversation about the police civilian review board is about removing the current chair, who openly sided with the police in the last meeting, but i know that would be wildly optimistic.    https://t.co/LZpvfisk2C

name: molly conger
tweet: i mean, according to the actual police morale surveys, which the mayor posted on FB the other day, most cops just desperately crave more free snacks & treats (they're also worried they might actually get in trouble if they beat people, which i guess they didn't use to fear)

name: molly conger
tweet: and we are in session! everyone looks extremely happy to be here.  https://t.co/iYEFzrSUS5

name: molly conger
tweet: lloyd snook makes a motion to add to the agenda a discussion of the ADA coordinator position. mayor walker makes a motion to add a discussion of the termination of the police chief. lloyd's motion carries 5-0, the mayor's motion does not receive a second & it dies without a vote.

name: molly conger
tweet: lloyd snook adds to the announcements that the charlottesville high school football team "won its first game in a very, very long time" last week. good for them!

name: molly conger
tweet: mayor walker says she would like to thank chief brackney for her service & apologize on behalf of the city for a termination that will hurt her reputation.  (i bet the city attorney is a little anxious hearing this, not knowing if a wrongful termination suit is coming)

name: molly conger
tweet: mayor walker, speaking to the recently terminated chief brackney, who is not on the call, says "i hope that you continue to make this change somewhere in this world; i wish it was here," but that some community will benefit from her work.

name: molly conger
tweet: there is a lingering silence after mayor walker's approximately 8 minute monologue about the police chief, then the clerk reads the consent agenda.  https://t.co/6IwmyJquIQ

name: molly conger
tweet: the prosecutor himself said last year he doesn't actually know why the program requires guilty pleas but didn't seem interested in changing it    https://t.co/GoJnoRl1Wc

name: molly conger
tweet: jeff fogel has called in to again ask why people participating in the drug court program have to enter a guilty plea in order to receive treatment. this is not a legal requirement, the city could choose to change this!

name: molly conger
tweet: there was no discussion about the consent agenda, so i'm not sure which item prompted the mayor to vote against it, but the consent agenda carries 4-1, which the mayor dissenting.

name: molly conger
tweet: city manager chip boyles says staff are working on a report summarizing the funds the city has provided for direct housing support & supportive services to families vs funding to nonprofits & other agencies supporting housing initiatives.

name: molly conger
tweet: all employees, visitors, and contractors entering city hall must wear a mask. the city is not currently requiring vaccines or regular surveillance testing for employees, but boyles says this is an option that is available based on rising COVID cases.

name: molly conger
tweet: and now for public comment. dr forrest calland is a UVA trauma surgeon calling in about the proximity based dispatch system recently implemented by the fire dept. he says this is part of an ongoing push against the cville-albemarle rescue squad (CARS)

name: molly conger
tweet: dr calland says survival is actually INVERSELY proportional to the number of paramedics employed in the area - having too many paramedics means none of them get enough calls each year to stay competent.

name: molly conger
tweet: he is also concerned that the new paramedic firefighters were hired with grant funding that expires in 2 years - will that $2mil come out of the city budget in 2 years?

name: molly conger
tweet: next is elizabeth stark speaking in favor of creating a more dense, walkable, equitable city.  of the recent NIMBY comments, she says "these landowners tell us that they do support racial equity, but only when moves toward an equitable future have no effect on them personally."

name: molly conger
tweet: elizabeth finishes her comments by saying that we need & deserve an explanation for the termination of the police chief and that bellamy brown went outside the scope of the PCRB in advocating for the police against their boss.

name: molly conger
tweet: ms gloria beard also feels that the people of the city need some answers and is shocked that even the mayor was in the dark about the police chief's termination.

name: molly conger
tweet: "damn it, don't be so rude!" jeff fogel says, he is at his wits end with what he calls "impolite, rude, and insufferable" behavior from council when asked for answers & they just... stare silently.

name: molly conger
tweet: "this police department hates the community. it's the community they hate. chief brackney will be gone and they will continue to hate us," fogel says. "we will continue to target abusive police officers, we will have a PCRB."

name: molly conger
tweet: "the temporal proximity was such as to only lead to the conclusion that you were caving to the PBA," fogel tells city manager chip boyles about the chief's firing coming immediately after the leaked police union surveys saying officers didn't like her.

name: molly conger
tweet: jeff is right - if boyles fired brackney because of pressure from the police union, we are not safe with him as city manager. if he fired her for some other reason, he needs to tell us.

name: molly conger
tweet: melvin burruss says the PBA survey had only 64 respondents and we don't even know who they went out to. he thanks mayor walker for her "comments on the wrongful termination of the chief."

name: molly conger
tweet: kara elms, a resident of st charles, MO, has called into the meeting... i guess st charles, missouri is trying to buy our sacagawea statue? kara is talking about issues in st charles but i don't know what our city council can do about that.  https://t.co/oCoN7G6OB2

name: molly conger
tweet: sounds like we shouldn't let saint charles, missouri have our old statue, though?

name: molly conger
tweet: leavell says the recent changes to the proximity based dispatch system will decrease the likelihood that advanced life support (ALS) resources are available when they are needed.

name: molly conger
tweet: virginia leavell, the chief of the cville-alb rescue squad, has called in about the change to the EMS dispatch system. last year, 83% of EMS calls required the lowest level of pre-hospital care, 11% required no transport.

name: molly conger
tweet: leavell cites several specific recent incidents during which people with severe chest pain waited longer for EMS services because the ALS resources available had been dispatched to low-level emergencies like a student with a swollen foot.

name: molly conger
tweet: if i'm understanding this correctly, the new dispatch system sends the closest unit NO MATTER WHAT the unit's capabilities are or what the emergency requires, so ALS units get sent to BLS calls, taking them offline during actual ALS calls?

name: molly conger
tweet: "why do you all want to stay quiet about what happened to the chief of police?" ms katrina turner asks the council. "business shouldn't be as normal tonight - regular business should be shut down tonight because this city is going to hell & nobody wants to talk about it."

name: molly conger
tweet: it really seems like the people who show up when you need an ambulance are the ones to listen to here, especially after the last 18 months of a highly contagious deadly respiratory virus causing people to call 911 a lot.

name: molly conger
tweet: tevendale says the city's approach to EMS dispatch appears to be based on an attempt to "overwhelm the emergency with with an increased number of people and vehicles present"

name: molly conger
tweet: shawn tevendale, a bike store owner & the VP of CARS, says a vast majority of EMS calls are basic life support calls that can be handled without lights & sirens or ALS resources. this keeps critical care resources available for critical care calls.

name: molly conger
tweet: don gathers says he is "surprised and taken aback" by council's refusal to second the mayor's motion to discuss the police chief's firing. "people in the community are wondering what exactly is going on and the inaction of tonight" doesn't really help with that.

name: molly conger
tweet: harrison brookeman, a former medic at CARS who has since moved away to attend medical school, says response times alone are not the best measure of effective EMS care. he urges the city to explore better ways of providing efficient, effective EMS care.

name: molly conger
tweet: "where is the urgency required to meet the crisis?" asks gregory weaver about the climate crisis. "some are saying we still need more parking," but the city should look at everything through a climate lens - does this action lead to a decrease in emissions?

name: molly conger
tweet: people won't switch to riding the bus unless is it comparably convenient to driving!!! weaver says without consistent, reliable 10 minute service, people who drive just won't make the change.

name: molly conger
tweet: "let's make people want to ride [the bus] - let's start covering our bus stops, let's start increasing frequency, let's expand routes, let's increase service hours. let's start transforming our city & making major dents in our carbon footprint today." i'm standing & clapping!!!

name: molly conger
tweet: andrew shelton tells chip boyles that without any answers from him, it's hard to see the chief's firing as anything other than kowtowing to the PBA. "if i were in a position to fire you, i would very seriously consider it."

name: molly conger
tweet: lloyd snook, an attorney by trade, says his concern about having a public discussion about the chief's firing without solid ground rules opens the city up to all kinds of liability. he says he asked about parameters for this conversation & no one could answer.

name: molly conger
tweet: snook says what happened to CARS' budget last year was "grossly unfair to them" & that the current dispatch situation makes it look like the contributions of CARS, which he calls a 'beloved institution,' are not valued.

name: molly conger
tweet: snook says no one is prepared to have a conversation about the proximity based dispatch system tonight, but asks city manager boyles to figure out how & when this important conversation can be had.

name: molly conger
tweet: councilor michael payne says the timing of the chief's firing has created a lot of concern in the community - does this send a signal that CPD is 'going back to the old ways of doing things,' and giving up on reform?

name: molly conger
tweet: councilor heather hill says she has "confidence that that those things were not directly linked," re: the timing of brackney's firing with the PBA surveys coming out, but offers no reason or support for her belief that this is true. she says it is a sensitive personnel discussion

name: molly conger
tweet: mayor walker, on the subject of a public discussion of the chief's firing, says "we were advised not to take that route," (i assume by the city attorney, who probably has a migraine now) but that they technically can.

name: molly conger
tweet: mayor walker says chief brackney is actually on the call, so she can answer questions if necessary. lloyd snook says there are other employees involved whose confidentiality has to be respected.

name: molly conger
tweet: this is the most toxic work environment i have ever witnessed

name: molly conger
tweet: honestly just fuck the agenda. who needs it. we're off the rails, baby!

name: molly conger
tweet: the mayor brought fire chief dr hezedean smith on, who initially declined to speak, saying he'd been advised against it. city manager chip boyles tells him he's free to respond, which seems to alleviate his hesitancy.

name: molly conger
tweet: chief smith says "improving the system requires a level of changing the status quo, which sometimes encourages stakeholders to move from how things have always been done to adopt best practices, which must align with the needs of the community"

name: molly conger
tweet: smith says since implementing proximity based dispatch on july 24, ambulances are responding to EMS calls in 10th & page 12% faster, 16% faster on ridge st, and 4 minutes faster in fifeville.

name: molly conger
tweet: chief smith does not address the concerns raised by the trauma surgeon & the paramedics who said this system has already resulted in people who need advanced life support services not being able to get them right away.

name: molly conger
tweet: city attorney lisa robertson says CARS has had an attorney contact her about the issue. robertson says chief smith will need to bring council up to speed on the decision to change the dispatch system & there is "an intention" to meet with CARS.

name: molly conger
tweet: "this is his job. it is his job to run the city under our overarching policies," vice mayor sena magill says of the city manager. firing the police chief is the city manager's job in this structure of government.

name: molly conger
tweet: mayor walker believes that other councilors have been having private conversations with the city manager behind her back, perhaps encouraging him to fire the police chief but at the very least that they had some foreknowledge she did not have. they all say this is not true.

name: molly conger
tweet: i guess we're gonna get to the agenda eventually  https://t.co/GDs5RCFLVf

name: molly conger
tweet: oh ok time for a 15 minute recess

name: molly conger
tweet: oh now we're doing the items on the agenda - changing the term length for members of the retirement commission. it is easier administratively if all members of the board are serving terms of the same length, staggered to prevent loss of institutional knowledge.  https://t.co/lEnXATHWAI

name: molly conger
tweet: snook calls the retirement commission changes "common sense changes," and it'll go on the next consent agenda for a vote. no real discussion necessary. now it's powerpoint time.  https://t.co/l17wjMmJ8C

name: molly conger
tweet: i hate this intersection so much i just never go there. i stopped shopping at that whole shopping center to avoid having to drive there. i probably will not find out if this fixes it.  https://t.co/xpupfhHfai

name: molly conger
tweet: according to the presenter, brian copeland, there is no protected bike lane in this intersection because so much of the public comment emphasized preserving the tree canopy. adding the bike lane would mean either taking out canopy trees or relocating a lot of utilities.

name: molly conger
tweet: snook moves to approve the resolution approving the design features for the barracks road-emmet street smartscale improvement project. it carries 5-0.

name: molly conger
tweet: next agenda item is actually several items -  https://t.co/2c3n7JQMDJ

name: molly conger
tweet: the city has gotten 7 offers for the sacagawea statue. all the people offering to take it have said they will pay for the cost to move it.  https://t.co/frKCyXITO2

name: molly conger
tweet: the statue was removed the same day as the lee & jackson statues in july   https://t.co/J3U8vwUqyP

name: molly conger
tweet: sacagawea's descendents say it should be melted down, but it doesn't seem like that is one of the options the city is entertaining.    https://t.co/YlAkPLj3Y1

name: molly conger
tweet: charlottesville city council voted to remove the statue in november 2019 during a meeting with descendants of sacagawea as well as representatives from local indigenous groups  https://t.co/shu5BzyGjv

name: molly conger
tweet: lloyd snook says that "sentiment among the native american community is not unanimous" about whether the statue is offensive. lloyd was not on council when her descendants flew here & wept at this awful depiction of their ancestor.    https://t.co/vIptoHIYZf

name: molly conger
tweet: heather makes the motion to ratify the emergency vote taken on july 10 to remove the statue (they'd voted in 2019 to take it down, the july 10 vote was to go ahead and use the crane crew we already had in town to actually DO IT that day) it carries 5-0.

name: molly conger
tweet: staff will prepare more information about the 7 proposals to take the statue so council can determine its final disposition.  on to the item added to the agenda - discussion of the ADA coordinator position.

name: molly conger
tweet: the city has really struggled to keep someone in the job of ADA coordinator. the proposal is to have alex ikefuna from NDS temporarily take on that job in addition to his current duties at neighborhood development services while they hire a new ADA coordinator.

name: molly conger
tweet: snook says ADA coordinator is one of the few staff positions that is actually appointed by council - this is spelled out in the ADA transition plan. ordinarily, staff issues are handled by staff, not council.

name: molly conger
tweet: the appointment of alex ikefuna as interim ADA coordinator carries 5-0. i hope the city hires someone to run HR soon because the number of vacancies is... expanding rapidly & if we're asking staff to do multiple jobs, they might help grow the list.

name: molly conger
tweet: mayor walker again alleges that bellamy brown, the chair of the PCRB, collaborated with the PBA against the chief as retaliation for him not getting the PCRB executive director position.

name: molly conger
tweet: it actually didn't get discussed at all because it was on the consent agenda, but council voted tonight to approve the city manager's hiring recommendation for that position - hansel aguilar has been selected to head up the police civilian review board as its exec director

name: molly conger
tweet: the mayor has a lot of questions that honestly i think we all deserve answers to! who wrote the unsigned press release from august 20? if it was the police dept, why didn't their press office release it?

name: molly conger
tweet: a new-to-me allegation just surfaced - mayor walker says if michael wells (an ablemarle county detective who is also the president of the PBA) was secretly recording meetings with now-acting-chief mooney, who has seen those tapes?

name: molly conger
tweet: mayor walker also wants to know how concerns that surfaced on the surveys were validated. have exit interviews been conducted with officers who left the department?

name: molly conger
tweet: on to closing matters by the public.  ang conn says of the situation with the police chief, the city has proven that oppressive institutions cannot be reformed and no matter how hard you try to reform them, they will always uphold white supremacy

name: molly conger
tweet: ang also asks if the city offers any kind of assistance funds for application fees for low income individuals & housing voucher recipients trying to find places to live. (some local landlords will EAT YOU ALIVE just to look at your application!)

name: molly conger
tweet: john sales from CRHA says current funding for the housing vouchers does not allow deposit or application assistance, but the new emergency housing vouchers do allow this.

name: molly conger
tweet: don gathers asks why the city doesn't just like mooney go on into his retirement (he'd announced his retirement prior to the chief's firing but will now stay on as interim chief) & appoint tito durrette as interim chief   https://t.co/SJIUSAAuQF

name: molly conger
tweet: michael wells is now on the call   https://t.co/BkLxQSM4N2

name: molly conger
tweet: wells says he wants to acknowledge mr boyles "for doing the right thing and a good job" (i assume he's referring to firing chief brackney... how much influence did albemarle county cops have on the ouster of the cville police chief?)

name: molly conger
tweet: wells says there were issues with "internal procedural justice" and that "officers who feel respected by their organizations are more likely to bring this respect into the interactions with people they serve."

name: molly conger
tweet: michael wells, an albemarle county detective, says one of the problems with the city of charlottesville is "you have a few people who speak up all the time" and it garners too much of the city's attention. "now i'm gonna be one of those people."

name: molly conger
tweet: "i'm not saying anything," "i'm not gonna answer that," wells says, interrupting mayor walker's questions to him about whether he secretly recorded meetings with asst chief mooney and used those recordings "to threaten the city manager"

name: molly conger
tweet: "you can't afford a police department with limitless internal distractions and nonexistent morale," wells says.  "where are your facts about racist policing? provide it to me. provide it to me," wells says, antagonizing & interrupting the mayor repeatedly before hanging up.

name: molly conger
tweet: we are about to see an extreme uptick in extremely racist, violent behavior from our cops, huh?

name: molly conger
tweet: oh wow i forgot we were still in the middle of public comment, what with the mayor accusing the president of the police union of using secret recordings of the assistant police chief to threaten the city manager & him not denying that. but we are still having public comment.

name: molly conger
tweet: ms katrina turner has called in to remind us all the the CHAIR OF THE POLICE CIVILIAN REVIEW BOARD is in bed with the PBA, who i guess maybe allegedly hypothetically just blackmailed the city manager? i think we have a problem.

name: molly conger
tweet: katrina is right - there is literally no way anyone can or should trust the police civilian review board to provide any kind of oversight of the police or meaningful resolution to complaints about the police as long as bellamy brown remains on the board.

name: molly conger
tweet: nancy carpenter, an actual angel on this earth, starts her comments by asking ang to reach out to her & she may be able to find resources for people with housing vouchers who need help with rental application fees

name: molly conger
tweet: nancy, a member of the PCRB, says hansel aguilar, who has been selected as the PCRB exec director, will need data from the police department in order to be effective in his role & hopes that the city manager can ensure that data is made available by the interim police chief.

name: molly conger
tweet: someone who identifies himself as "tee rar" says he wants to "liberate" the monuments to those "two great american heroes and patriots" (he means the confederate statues) the disposition of those statues is not up for discussion tonight.

name: molly conger
tweet: dr forrest calland has called back in about the proximity dispatch policy. he says CARS has provided 80% of all EMS care in cville for the last 10 years - will CARS be a stakeholder at the upcoming meeting to discuss the dispatch policy?   https://t.co/wqqpmcOq7J

name: molly conger
tweet: mayor walker refers back to the city attorney's comments earlier - there will be a meeting soon during which city council will be brief by chief smith about the change. robertson says the meeting is public, so CARS reps are welcome to join as a members of the public.

name: molly conger
tweet: dr calland again asks why CARS, who provides the vast majority of EMS services in the city, has not been asked to participate in briefing council about changes to the way EMS services are provided.

name: molly conger
tweet: lisa robertson, the city attorney, says city council will be briefed by their own fire chief. she's being painfully careful with her words, probably because CARS has already sent their lawyer to talk to her about this.

name: molly conger
tweet: chief smith says he canceled the meeting with CARS because of the "disrespectful nature" of the letter CARS sent and also because they'd retained legal counsel.

name: molly conger
tweet: literally anyone who might show up at your house if you call 911 in charlottesville is actively engaged in bureaucratic combat with the city. this seems untenable.

name: molly conger
tweet: kate fraleigh says council should act swiftly to adopt the ordinance & hearing procedures for the PCRB, which is nice i guess but i'm not sure the PCRB is worth anything at all if they can climb into bed with the police union.  chip boyles says hansel aguilar starts on the 27th.

name: molly conger
tweet: numerous callers have chastised councilors for their silence tonight, but i'm willing to bet the city attorney has instructed them not to speak on several of the issues that came up tonight that seem likely to result in litigation.

name: molly conger
tweet: i guess when those lawsuits eventually get filed, maybe we'll at least get some version of answers.

name: molly conger
tweet: well this instantly earned itself a spot in the pantheon of most deranged meetings ever held in charlottesville. meeting adjourned.
